content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-074-01-A
|Item_parent=Prescription and monitoring of psychotropic drugs (see item 330)
|Item_parent_short=Prescription and monitoring of psychotropic drugs (see item 330)
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the definition and main classes of psychotropic drugs
|Description=Antipsychotics; Antidepressants; Anxiolytics; Hypnotics; Thymoregulators; Psychostimulants
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Louise Carton,Florian Naudet,Marie Tournier
|Order=1}}

'''Psychotropic drugs''': all chemical substances of natural or artificial origin which have a '''psychological''' effect, i.e. are capable of modifying mental activity.

'''Main classes''' :

* antipsychotics
* antidepressants
* anxiolytics
* hypnotics
* thymoregulators
* psychostimulants.

question.title: What are the main classes of psychotropic drugs?
question.description: Antipsychotics; Antidepressants; Anxiolytics; Hypnotics; Thymoregulators; Psychostimulants

option_a.title: Antipsychotics
option_a.description: Chemical substances that modify mental activity

option_b.title: Antidepressants
option_b.description: Chemical substances that modify mental activity

option_c.title: Anxiolytics
option_c.description: Chemical substances that modify mental activity

option_d.title: Hypnotics
option_d.description: Chemical substances that modify mental activity

correct_option.title: Antipsychotics
correct_option.description: Chemical substances that modify mental activity
